featured.text: Today, the Paralympics are sports events for athletes from six different disability groups.
Many athletes and VIPs demand payment for their signatures, and many people are willing to pay.
Refugee athletes have been invited to compete in the Olympic Games since 2016.
While winning a gold _____ is what every Olympic athlete dreams of, it becomes meaningless if it is achieved by cheating.

other.text: Another study looked at non-smoking 6 athletes who had smoking parents or friends.
The number of athletes 28 in the Summer Paralympic Games has increased from 400 athletes from 23 countries in 1960 to 3,806 athletes from 136 countries in 2004.
At the closing ceremony of the Olympic Games, all the athletes ________ good-bye to the audience.
In the past, the signatures of athletes and VIPs __________.
Being 7 cigarette smoke hurt the athletes' lungs, and made them 8 more than athletes who did not have smokers close 9 , the study said.
According to this passage, many people now collect athletes’ and VIPs’ signatures __________.
Here are two refugee athletes and their stories.

definition.zh_def: 運動員：專門從事體育運動的人，通常參加比賽或訓練以提高體能和技能。
definition.en_def: Athlete: A person who is trained or skilled in sports, games, or exercises requiring physical strength, agility, or stamina.
definition.example: The athlete won a gold medal in the Olympics.
